message: @bmelton Not yet, they're launching soon. I'm trying via their twitter but ussually it's not so effective
was reading that article about Milk, not yet sure what they're gonna do.. .they're not really an incubator

They're launching an pseudo-incubator for mobile companies who're going to disrupt the market ( http://techcrunch.com/2011/04/04/milk-kevin-roses-new-company-aims-to-solve-big-problems-on-the-mobile-web/ ).
They've got a twitter feed, and presumably, they'll have an idea submission form at some point.
I need to talk with him and pitching him my Challengein
@ccarnino Try messaging Daniel Burka on Facebook. He has about 800+ friends. Better chance of getting to him through FB than through Twitter.
@ccarnino I like the app that you're doing, how long did it take you to develop?
Tecnically 10 weeks full-time. Both web service and app, plus content. 2 founders.
Now we're workin by a month after the launch. Taking feedback and improving
@chrisnet cool tip. I'll do it now ;)

It turns out I'm pitching this everywhere today, but if you're looking for coverage, you should probably check out loudstartup.com -- it's a list of all the sites I know of that cover tech startups, sorted by market reach.
MILK is more of a development lab, which means they will hire programmers and create frameworks and things like, i don't think they would accept a pitch of an idea

That would be really easy to do with disqus.  The joke for that site is that I literally created it while I was on a boring conference call.  It's a 2 hour project, and people seem to like it.  Fleshing it out makes good sense.

@bmelton really great site. Maybe consider adding some sort of commenting feature for each site, to let people leave notes about that site ie best way to structure your pitch for that specific site, peoples experience getting coverage on that site, etc.
@matwill Oh, and thanks for the compliment!
@bmelton Tnx for the result, I'll use it in the next days!
@italiano40 I've intended it as sort of meta-incubator where their team is working technically on the product they incubate... But I can be wrong
